intro: Corydalis eccremocarpa, commonly known as the pink corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred petals and clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland and rocky habitats, preferring cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are slender and branched. Corydalis eccremocarpa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
